description: Enterprise techniques used by NPPSPY, ATT&CK software S1131 (v1.0)
name: NPPSPY (S1131)

techniques.comment: [NPPSPY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1131) opens a new network listener for the mpnotify.exe process that is typically contacted by the Winlogon process in Windows. A new, alternative RPC channel is set up with a malicious DLL recording plaintext credentials entered into Winlogon, effectively intercepting and redirecting the logon information.(Citation: Huntress NPPSPY 2022)
[NPPSPY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1131) collection is automatically recorded to a specified file on the victim machine.(Citation: Huntress NPPSPY 2022)
[NPPSPY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1131) records data entered from the local system logon at Winlogon to capture credentials in cleartext.(Citation: Huntress NPPSPY 2022)

[NPPSPY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1131) creates a network listener using the misspelled label logincontroll recorded to the Registry key HKLM\\SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Control\\NetworkProvider\\Order.(Citation: Huntress NPPSPY 2022)

[NPPSPY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1131) captures user input into the Winlogon process by redirecting RPC traffic from legitimate listening DLLs within the operating system to a newly registered malicious item that allows for recording logon information in cleartext.(Citation: Huntress NPPSPY 2022)
[NPPSPY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1131) modifies the Registry to record the malicious listener for output from the Winlogon process.(Citation: Huntress NPPSPY 2022)

[NPPSPY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1131) captures credentials by recording them through an alternative network listener registered to the mpnotify.exe process, allowing for cleartext recording of logon information.(Citation: Huntress NPPSPY 2022)
